name: strand-dropdown
description: A fully-styled dropdown list containing multiple options.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Sets the visual and interaction state to be disabled.

attributes.name: error
attributes.description: When set, will display an invalid visual state - a red line around the dropdown button. This property can be used to provide user feedback for validation.

attributes.name: fitparent
attributes.description: When set, instructs the component to fill the width of its parent container.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Sets the default text which appears on the dropdown button.

attributes.name: maxItems
attributes.description: Limits the number of list items displayed in the dropdown panel, allowing the list to scroll vertically if necessary.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Sets or returns the value of the currently selected item.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: The data which populates the dropdown panel list, expressed as an array of objects with key value pairs i.e. - [ { name: 'name', value: 'value' }, {...} ]. If a data array is provided to strand-dropdown, it will ONLY be populated by the provided data, as it does not support mixing dom and data configuration.

attributes.name: itemHeight
attributes.description: Returns the height of a single item in the dropdown panel list.

attributes.name: buttonWidth
attributes.description: Returns the width of the dropdown button.

attributes.name: paddingWidth
attributes.description: Returns the cumulative width of the padding of the dropdown button i.e. - paddingLeft + paddingRight.

attributes.name: borderWidth
attributes.description: Returns the cumulative width of the border of the dropdown button i.e. - borderLeft + borderRight.

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Instructs the component to be displayed at a predetermined size (i.e. - 'normal' or 'large').

attributes.name: skinless
attributes.description: Instructs the component to be displayed without a background or border.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the dropdown to it's default state.

methods.name: requestInitialization
methods.description: Under especially unusual circumstances, the dropdown may not initialize (nor render) properly.  This method can be invoked to correct any such issue.  Generally, developers should never need to call this method - however, it should be idempotent (and thus safe to call multiple times successively).

detail.name: value
detail.description: The value of the selected strand-list-item. If no value was supplied, it will return the text content of the list item.

detail.name: item
detail.description: The data object which was selected.

detail.name: index
detail.description: The index of data object which was selected.

detail.name: value
detail.description: The value property of data object which was selected.

detail.name: name
detail.description: The name property of data object which was selected.

detail.name: selected
detail.description: The selected state of the item.
